alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 29 at 12:16AM EDT until September 29 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Melbourne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Osceola County in east central Florida... * Until 315 AM EDT. * At 1216 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 6 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 4 to 6 inches, with locally higher amounts are expected in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Saint Cloud, Holopaw, Lake Kissimmee, Lake Marian, Narcoossee, Kenansville, West Lake Toho, Poinciana, Harmony, Campbell, Forever Florida, Alligator Lake and Pine Grove. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
